title: is how I speak "toxic"?
body:
So i recently got a restriction for a few games, and now I'm sitting here on locked level 1 honor, probably gonna miss out on end of season rewards (as a graves player this really is a bummer).

So Im sitting here thinking to myself im not even THAT toxic, ill get times where i say something I shouldn't but not anything I wouldnt say to my friends and family, and that's what made me think to myself "is it just the way I speak". I live in a rough part of Scotland and all around me you have insults thrown at each other as a greeting, the bigger the insult the more welcomed you are to see someone, but when I go into a game online I dont put a filter on how I type, its the way I am, and why do I have to act like someone im not when in a game......

Sorry for the rant, this is really just me getting annoyed at the out-of-no-where honor lock but If i had to ask a question it would be: What is the line between toxic and someone taking advice/conversation as an insult in this game?

replies.body: unless its a 2week ban you will get rewards as long as you play enough games to remove your chat restriction
so even though im locked at honor 1 ill still get the gold border?

As we announced in August, certain players are ineligible for this seasonâ€™s rewards:

- Players with bans or chat restrictions active when the season ends.
- Players issued a ban of seven days or more after 8/22/2017.
- Players banned for boosting during the 2017 season.
Players who experience fraud-related or erroneous bans will still be eligible.

so does the punishment count as active while your honor level is locked or does it purely mean when you have the restrictions? thanks for the info tho!
while the restrictions are active i believe
oh my, If i missed a victorious bard skin i dont know what I would do with my life... probably cry...a lot

That's awesome man. I love affectionately insulting people as a show of friendship. Don't change. However, when on league, you honestly do have to tone it down. You gotta strip yourself of your personality, for the sake of keeping your account safe. The line is very blurred, but keeping your account safe actually is quite simple, you just gotta steer clear of that line. Don't ride it. 

You can give advice, as long as you don't throw in anything negative with it. Phrase it as strictly what you think they should do (not what they shouldnt do! In other words, "stop dying" "dont go in 1v5" ...that shit is obvious, and not real advice) and then move on. Dont hound em about it, dont bring it up again. If they respond negatively, don't even speak to them again. 

The people that get in trouble for "giving advice" are those that continuously rag on people, and then when it's met with hostility, they take that as open season to insult the person, and it turns into a flame war. Then they cry "i was just speaking facts and I got banned derrrr".

i only shit talk maybe once or twice when they do something mind mindbogglingly stupid, or when they start to gloat about a mistake someone made then end up doing a few minutes later. I've never once got warned about my behavior, probably because i don't go over board with it and curse them out.

example, obnoxious ass ezreal and blitz i was against start gloating about how they are going to win today, flashing masteries. 

*entire team gets stomped, them included*

Blitz&Ez: lmao Trashuo (our yasuo was like 10/5 btw)

Vi (me): blitz, you've been missing the most brain dead skill shots, who are you calling trash

blitz: well that's because draven displaces my skillshot (a majority of the skillshot i've seen him miss, draven wasn't even around)

*gets either stomped further*

Blitz&Ez: gg trash team, vi carried you guys (16/2)

Vi: you know what everyone, lets report these obnoxious trash ass kids

*everyone agrees*

I'd say intentionally making somebody feel worse about themselves is toxicity, and doing so with frequency leads to punishments. Admonition, strategic correction, and general advice is fine. But if your Lee Sin messes up a gank by missing his Q or something, calling him a "boosted ape" repeatedly for the rest of the game isn't gonna accomplish anything other than making him tilt and opening yourself up to punishment. 

In general, don't be a dick.
